result.execSummary:
The defendant Hector (nmi) Hernandez Balleza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hector (nmi) Hernandez Balleza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hector (nmi) Hernandez Balleza was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Domestic Abuse and Anger Management.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence FORTHWITH.  Any outstanding fines/costs to be coverted to civil judgment
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Defendant Hector (nmi) Hernandez Balleza by video from LEC with attorney Deb O'Rourke and interpreter Alejandra K.  Defendant Hector (nmi) Hernandez Balleza in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht and intern Rick Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests $500 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty O'Rourke responds/requests signature bond/DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/S.M. other than incidental at the apartment building and absolute sobriety at all times.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
